WRITING.TEXT: Johnson. Gotta be Johnson. And yes, I find he's the biggest threat to every fighter at any weight class.

I think the biggest problem for Khabib is if he's ever matched up against someone like Tibau again, with equally talented takedown offense. I just don't know if there's anyone like that at Lightweight.

I think he takes Cruz maybe 8 times out of 10. But that's as long as he listens to his corner. Whatever gameplan they had, TJ just didn't do a thing to follow it in the later rounds. He had an easy path to victory with leg kicks and he just...wouldn't do it. Very strange.
Dodson, I think would be a huge problem for him, but I'd LOVE to see that rematch and find out.
I didn't think about that...dear God...why!?
Andrei Arlovski - Alistair Overeem ;_;
So basically Cain vs Browne is going to be an absurd slugfest.

If someone's going to do it, I'd rather it be a clear-cut undisputed champ like DJ or JBJ. I look forward to the inevitable rematch between DJ and Cruz. But if Faber wins, I'll definitely enjoy that fight as well.

I really, really like this. I don't love that it does the pop chorus hook thing that's super popular right now (I couldn't begin to describe what I'm trying to say, hopefully you get me), but the rest of the song more than wins me over. Time to hear more.

When I first started watching this sport mid-last year, Barboza was one of the first guys I really fell hard for as a favorite fighter. It was his leg kicks that really did it. Just some talented, dangerous, nasty stuff. The two fights of his, prior to last night, I'd been able to see were fantastic, but didn't really showcase that as much. It was nice to see him attack the leg in a live fight, and against such a high-caliber opponent.

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for some Dual Boot confirmation.
WRITING.TEXT:
I have windows 10 on an HP desktop with an Intel i7. If I buy an SSD, hook it up, disconnect the computers main hard drive, install Mavericks from a jump drive (I have a Macbook, so have access to Mavericks) onto the SSD, plug the pc HD back in, will I then be able to dual boot one or the other?
Sorry if this sounds stupid or obvious, I've never done something like this before, but can't function without a Mac in my work life any more.
Want this movie.

I took a test. Motorcycle law just wasn't on it.
Anyways I have no problem with it. Was surprised to see it, as I didn't realize you could do it.
Totally ok with it because it only happens in traffic, for the most part, while I'm not moving, so I don't expect to ever need to worry too much about someone flying out in front of me while I'm driving.
Creature of the night?

Thank you.
I moved to LA two years ago, and I've NEVER seen so much lane splitting as since I moved here. Just thought people were enjoying breaking the law, but then I saw several police officers doing it and was so confused. Quick google searching didn't explain it to me, but I never looked too hard into it.

I don't care about the price change. I just wish they would've spoken up about it. I looked through my e-mail and I don't seem to have the "Hey, in two years, this is going up." e-mail anymore, but it's totally possible I deleted it.
I just still remember them splitting the DVD and Streaming with no warning, and never quite got that bad taste out of my mouth. This just brought all of my negative feelings for Netflix right back, but I'm not going anywhere.
I thought you were supposed to measure ON the navel at the widest part. I'll try that when I get home, probably make a lot more sense. Thanks!

I get blood work done regularly for an autoimmune issue they want to be sure I don't have. Get to follow my results online afterwards, too, so I know that I'm doing well in all regards besides the one concern area.
Am I measuring myself incorrectly? I'm down to 128 pounds, I'm 5'1", but no matter what, I always seem to have a 35" waist. I'm at 35.8" right now and I wear a size 6 or 8 pants.

When I saw this article on the app yesterday, I hoped I wouldn't see it posted here. The title was a bit click-baity with the fatlogic, but I Think the content was sound.
There is a lower limit to how many calories your body should be taking in. Under eating IS a thing. The important part is understanding the logic and difference between "starvation mode" bullshit, and sound advice.
I definitely thought the article was sound advice.
And for everyone kinda shitting on the blog, I'll have to disagree there as well. I've received a lot of motivation from their blog, and those recipes are pretty bad-ass majority of the time.
Meanwhile, the Region just wants to be recognized as part of Illinois already.

I'm glad they've added the tile, but wow it would be nice to have the charge alert me. It looks like they don't have much of an intention on updating, but this is a fun thread to read, to know you're not alone in being frustrated:
https://community.fitbit.com/t5/Feature-Requests/Reminders-to-Move-for-Surge-and-Charge-HR/idi-p/1162197
Interesting. I'm not in the market to change from the Charge HR yet, so hopefully they put this in. Regardless, I love this update.

For me, if I'm trying to do something like hammer a nail, or thread a needle, my hands begin shaking uncontrollably. It's insane.
I told my doctor about it, and the way she diagnosed me was fairly amusing. She told me to go home and get drunk and see if my hands shook then. If they didn't, the tremor was nothing to worry about and was just an intentional tremor and was likely indicative of nothing major. Sure enough, when I got home, had a few beers (so that I was tipsy, but not so drunk that I wouldn't be able to do the action regardless), and tried to do a complicated action, my hands weren't shaking. It was so strange.
Anyways, she said it was NBD, but they'd watch it as I get older to be certain. To my knowledge I have no brain injuries, strokes or MS, but that last one isn't out of the realm of possibility.
Thankfully I haven't had too much trouble with new phones, but I miss physical keyboards. Slider phones were the best thing ever.
I was just wondering if it was the same people. Loved that product on Shark Tank, but this is even better.

WRITING.TITLE: SV/BMI - I'm at a "healthy" weight on both BMI charts
WRITING.TEXT:
I wanted to wait until I weighed in consistently at my new weight before posting, but it's been a week now and all signs are pointing to finally achieving my main goal: I'm no longer overweight. On either BMI scale. The new BMI made me lose an extra 5 pounds, I believe, but it's done now.
I can not be more grateful to all of the subs I've been following as my struggle to get over final hurdles in the last year were beginning to get me down. Now all I want is to get somewhere in the middle of the range and stay there.
This is one of the happiest days of my life, to be honest.
Thank you all again.
How I did it: Counting calories and exercise worked for a long time, but I realized recently I was doing little snacking too often and not counting it. I got a food scale, started portioning my food out so I could snack throughout the day without busting my calorie limit. Also started eating a lot more greek yogurt.

Haha! I had this realization at one point, as well, and got super happy about it. I needed to give my weight the other day when I was donating blood, and the lady was looking at my license at the same time as I said my current weight, and I chuckled to myself about being caught in my "lie".
I combated that by making my portion sizes way smaller, and then eating throughout the day. I'm well withing my limits, and I'm hardly ever hungry, because my brain is getting it's craving satisfied.
I've seen those once in a while, and I love them.
5'1" here. Honestly, I *can't* even eat 2K Calories anymore, unless I eat a bunch of junk, now that I've grown accustomed to eating below my maintenance number. I'm usually way too full if I do.

Wasn't there an ad campaign a while back about the face of depression? How you can't just tell by looking at someone how deeply unwell they might actually be, in order to raise understanding of the way we treat people in our every day life. If there isn't...there should be, lol.

As I mentioned separately, I was disappointed with the layout of the book, but for the exact opposite reason. The blog was a series of anecdotes about her childhood/life, until the very end, when it became very obvious that Brosh was going through something very big. Before that moment, everything was pretty amusing/lighthearted.
The book is structured in a way that it comes out hitting hard on the emotions from the start, with it being obvious she's got adjustment issues, through her (new?) entry about motivation, and the seemingly innocent letter to her 5 year old self suddenly takes a darker meaning when placed in such close contact with the darker stuff.

McCarthy, Dick and Vonnegut for me as well. They definitely more than impressed.
Hell, I always knew I'd like Dick's work. It just never seemed to be the right place/right time to read.

The one thing that really made me feel like the cop was kinda harassing him is because he wrote him a ticket for having a plate cover. Like, I know those are technically not OK, but who ever gets a ticket for those?
Shallow? That seems like the least accurate word to use. No problem with you not liking it, but shallow is one of the last words I'd use to describe her work.

I'm really disappointed in the way they laid this book out. I have been a fan for a long time, but by opening with so many of her more depressing entries, it makes the funny ones about her youth come across as dark foreshadowing, rather than amusing anecdotes about a uniquely amusing child.
Of course it's about beauty standards and not health.
It just happened itt...

This sub is just way too negative. I wish every thread about new ideas didn't devolve into some argument about how the books are somehow unworthy because they have film adaptations or about the gender, nationality, whatever of the author.
I haven't even felt like coming in here in two weeks because the conversation is so stagnant. Which really bums me out.
Constructively, as I've said before, more threads promoting conversation about potential nominees and more fun fact threads would get me back into this a bit. I always knew comedy month would lose my interest, so hopefully I can get the spark back next month.
This is what I love the Internet for.
Right on, missed that interview, thanks.

Well, I've seen it said on here before that his reporting style is kinda changed since he started working for Fox. That he couldn't ask some of the tougher questions he would if he was independent, etc. I'm sort of assuming, I guess, but yeah, it seems like this is what's best for him to be able to work to his fullest.
Click the link.

Was sad, then read his reasoning and I totally get it.
EDIT: So there's no confusion. I don't mean to say he gave a clear cut reason. I'm kinda jumping to conclusions on this. I was only referring to him talking about already having a full time job. As I said in a response below, I just kinda took this to mean he wants to focus more on that, it seemed to be the implication in his words. There *could* be a bigger reason, I guess we may or may not find out.
I love when he goes off on his little expletive laced tears, so I'm all for it.

This is more what I expected. No offense to Holly, but all of that about them splitting coaches and whatever didn't make sense. They seem to have a lot more invested in Andrei, and a better relationship. Overeem seems to be at Jackson's to train, and that's it. There's absolutely nothing wrong with that, but if this is a question of loyalties, I'm not shocked to hear the team is "siding" with AA.
I know, lol. Every time I see her on the card, I'm like, "Yesssssssss Bethe is back." Then I'm like, *why do I care?*
